trans-unit.source: Determines whether an assembly belongs to a code group by testing its global assembly cache membership.
This class cannot be inherited.
All assemblies installed in the global assembly cache are granted the `FullTrust` permission set.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition"></xref> class.
Code satisfies this membership condition if it is installed in the global assembly cache.
Indicates whether the specified evidence satisfies the membership condition.
This membership condition tests <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacInstalled> evidence.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Evidence"></xref> against which to make the test.
`true` if the specified evidence satisfies the membership condition; otherwise, `false`.
Creates an equivalent copy of the membership condition.
A copy of a membership condition is identical to the original membership condition.
A new <xref href="System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition"></xref> object.
Indicates whether the current object is equivalent to the specified object.
There are no degrees of global assembly cache membership.
An assembly is either in the cache or it is not.
If the object identified by `o` is a <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition>, then the objects being compared are equal.
This method returns `false` only if `o` is `null` or if `o` is not a <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition>.
The object to compare with the current object.
`true` if o is a ; otherwise, `false`.
Uses the specified XML encoding to reconstruct a security object.

The <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition.FromXml%2A> method reconstructs a <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition> from an XML encoding defined by the <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement> class.
Use the <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition.ToXml%2A> method to XML-encode the <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition> including state information.
The <xref href="System.Security.SecurityElement"></xref> that contains the XML encoding to use to reconstruct the security object.
e is `null`.
e is not a valid membership condition element.
Uses the specified XML encoding to reconstruct a security object, using the specified policy level context.
The policy level context is provided for resolution of named permission set references.
For example, code groups use policy level to find named permission sets.
The <xref href="System.Security.SecurityElement"></xref> that contains the XML encoding to use to reconstruct the security object.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyLevel"></xref> context for resolving <xref href="System.Security.NamedPermissionSet"></xref> references.
e is `null`.
e is not a valid membership condition element.
Gets a hash code for the current membership condition.

The <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition.GetHashCode%2A> method returns 0 (zero) because <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition> objects have no properties to distinguish one from another.
0 (zero).
Returns a string representation of the membership condition.
The string representation for <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition> is "GAC".
A string representation of the membership condition.
Creates an XML encoding of the security object and its current state.
Use the <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition.FromXml%2A> method to restore the state information from a <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement>.
A <xref href="System.Security.SecurityElement"></xref> that contains the XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.
Creates an XML encoding of the security object and its current state, using the specified policy level context.
The policy level context is provided for resolution of named permission set references.
For example, code groups use policy level to find named permission sets.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyLevel"></xref> context for resolving <xref href="System.Security.NamedPermissionSet"></xref> references.
A <xref href="System.Security.SecurityElement"></xref> that contains the XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.
